glsa.title: NTFS-3G: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in NTFS-3G allows local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: NTFS-3G is a stable, full-featured, read-write NTFS driver for various operating systems.

description.p: NTFS-3G is affected by the same vulnerability as reported in “GLSA 201603-04” when the bundled fuse-lite implementation is used.

impact.p: A local user could gain root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. However, on Gentoo when the “external-fuse” USE flag is set or the “suid” USE flag is not set then NTFS-3G is not affected. Both of these cases are the default configuration.
